drivers.name: lj5gray
drivers.comments:
This driver is available in the Ghostscript Printer Application

This driver entry is for Ghostscript's PCL XL raster driver, accessible through the output devices "lj5gray" and "lj5mono". By choosing the output device the halftoning mode (grayscale or monochrome) is chosen. PPD files from this driver entry allow to set the halftoning mode by an option.

PCL-XL driver for the LaserJet 5, 6 (not 5L and 5P) and compatible models up to 1200 dpi resolution. Note that the "pxlmono"/"pxlcolor" drivers are much faster than this driver, but due to a bug they do not work in Ghostscript 5.50, in Ghostscript 6.51 they work excellently. "ljet4" is also much faster, but has a much worse output quality and on most printers it only does 600 dpi.

The resolution must be given with the "-r" option on the command line of Ghostscript. Preceeding the PostScript file by a PostScript command for setting the resolution does not work (at least not for 1200 dpi).

drivers.name: pxlmono
drivers.comments:
This driver is available in the Ghostscript Printer Application

Driver for monochrome PCL 6 printers, much faster than the "lj5gray" drivers.

The "pxlmono" and the "pxlcolor" driver are the same code, the difference is only that the "pxlcolor" gives colour and the "pxlmono" grayscale output. This entry for the "pxlmono" driver lists only monochrome printers. See the "pxlcolor" driver entry for color printers.

Due to a bug in Ghostscript Duplex does not work with the "pxlmono" and the "pxlcolor" drivers. Here is a patch for GPL Ghostscript 8.63. This patch is needed so that the Duplex option of the PPDs from this site works. Setting Duplex with PJL commands does not work.

The resolution must be given both with the "-r" option on the command line of Ghostscript and as PJL command. Here is a patch for GPL Ghostscript 8.63 so that giving the PJL commands is not necessary any more. This patch is needed for the resolution option of the PPDs of this site to work.

Another Ghostscript bug in the driver broke paper input tray selection. This patch for GPL Ghostscript 8.63 fixes the problem and allows to set the input tray with the "-dMediaPosition=X" commmand line option for Ghostscript. "X" is an integer number which depends on the printer model and tray. For HP "0" is usually the printer default, "1" automatic selection, "2" manual feed, "4" the upper, and "5" the lower tray. Note that for PCL 5/5e these numbers are different. This patch is required so that tray selection with the PPDs of this site works.

GPL Ghostscript 8.63 comes with a CUPS filter ("pstopxl") and 2 PPD files for the "pxlmono" and "pxlcolor" drivers. Note that you will need all the three patches mentioned here to make the options in the PPD files actually work. With this patch the filter and the PPDs will be made ready for PDF input.

The patches are all applied to GPL Ghostscript from version 8.64 on, so they are not needed any more with this version or later versions of Ghostscript.

notes:
Principally , this is a PostScript printer (in contrary to the non-network E120), but the printer only works in PostScript mode if the proprietary PPD file from the manufacturer is used, and not with a generic PostScript PPD file, like from Foomatic. It seems that the generic PPD file needs the additional line "*Protocols: TBCP", but there is no confirmation for this yet, so please test. See also this Ubuntu bug report.

Throughput = 20

Foomatic entry made by PPDtoXML T/G 0.19 on 2008-09-03
